noun.description: A piece of cloth tied around the head to cover someone's eyes.

verb.description: Deprive (someone) of sight by tying a piece of cloth around the head so as to cover the eyes.

adverb.description: With a blindfold covering the eyes.
examples: the reporter was driven blindfold to meet the gangster

origin: Mid 16th century: alteration, by association with fold, of blindfeld, past participle of obsolete blindfell strike blind, blindfold, from Old English geblindfellan (see blind, fell).
